hints.content:
First, we need to find $1$ third on the number line. 

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/a88d8e968091e333cb459fd250fa3d40c4af2a27)

Next, we need to split each third into $8$ equal parts.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/802484a698a5556d18265d6ab154aecccd49ea05)

There are $24$ equal parts per whole.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/40037712f34e22fa7ea818a30307116d10fb4e35)

Each tick mark represents a length of $\dfrac1{24}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d11d94cff1cac4a9ab8637913390a4279424dd71)

question.content:
**Divide.**   
*Use the number line below to help visualize $\dfrac13$ being divided by $8$.*

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/f31bef2de201c5b43530b5310c763a58f565b8d7)


$\dfrac13\div8=$  [[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]]
